results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Karen Murphy and Christopher Guest
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.

results.title: Best horse
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Nancy Gregory and Stephen Gyllenhaal
results.brief_description: Wendy Herstead, an eager teenager, is sure her beautiful sorrel horse Kick would win the Barrel Race event in the August rodeo, but her mother refuses to allow Wendy to enter. Wendy desperately schemes to raise the money for the entry fees and refuses to believe that Kick really isn’t a good barrel horse. Both mother and daughter learn important lessons about forcing people and animals into undesired roles.

results.title: Best friends
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and Bob Browning
results.brief_description: An animated film portraying the effects of cigarette smoke on the heart and lungs. What the noxious fumes of tobacco do to the defenceless lung tissue shouldn’t happen to an enemy, let alone a friend, as the film convincingly illustrates. For young viewers at an age where they might be enticed to take up smoking.

results.title: Best foot forward
results.brief_description: This film notes how various crawling creatures move, and then goes on to emphasize the importance of footfall patterns in animals which must control the action of four limbs at once. Suitable for Upper Primary level students. No other credits availble.

results.title: Besieged
results.creator_credit: Fiction, Massimo Cortesi and Bernardo Bertolucci
results.brief_description: In Rome, reclusive British composer Jason Kinsky lives in the building he inherited from his aunt, while his cleaning woman Shandurai resides in the basement, studying medicine. One day, Kinsky tells Shandurai that he loves her and will do anything for her, so she asks him to free her husband, a political prisoner back in Africa. To acquire funds for the man’s release, Kinsky begins selling his possessions, including his piano. Cast includes: Thandie Newton, David Thewlis and Claudio Santamaria.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses the role of the individual
results.brief_description: Lord Russell explains that he believes that important human advances have always been due to the activities of individuals. He discusses the relationship between the use of equipment to do important work and the loss of cultural and scientific freedom. He also comments on an orderly society with the maximum liberties of the individual. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses power
results.brief_description: Lord Russell speaks of three kinds of power: the power of armies and police forces, economic power and propaganda power. He discusses good and bad motives for wanting power and points out that the use and abuse of power is related to the difference between good government and bad. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses philosophy
results.brief_description: Lord Russell gives his definition of philosophy and speaks of the relationship and difference between science and philosophy. He describes his own philosophy and discusses the uses of philosophy, the trends of present-day philosophy and the future. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses mankind's future
results.brief_description: Lord Russell speaks about his fears and hopes for the future and explains that he sees the possibility of a world so organised and static that there will be no fun to be had anywhere. He points out also that with education and the realisation that many of the world’s troubles lie in individual psychology, we could abolish war, poverty and disease. No other credits available.

results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses happiness
results.brief_description: Lord Russell describes the factors which he considers necessary for happiness: health, sufficient means to keep one from want, happy personal relations and successful work. He also discusses what he considers to be the sources of unhappiness: worry, envy and boredom. No other credits available.
